00001 // This file contains definitions for the 
00002 // x86 memory management unit (MMU).
00003 
00004 // Eflags register
00005 #define FL_CF           0x00000001      // Carry Flag
00006 #define FL_PF           0x00000004      // Parity Flag
00007 #define FL_AF           0x00000010      // Auxiliary carry Flag
00008 #define FL_ZF           0x00000040      // Zero Flag
00009 #define FL_SF           0x00000080      // Sign Flag
00010 #define FL_TF           0x00000100      // Trap Flag
00011 #define FL_IF           0x00000200      // Interrupt Enable
00012 #define FL_DF           0x00000400      // Direction Flag
00013 #define FL_OF           0x00000800      // Overflow Flag
00014 #define FL_IOPL_MASK    0x00003000      // I/O Privilege Level bitmask
00015 #define FL_IOPL_0       0x00000000      //   IOPL == 0
00016 #define FL_IOPL_1       0x00001000      //   IOPL == 1
00017 #define FL_IOPL_2       0x00002000      //   IOPL == 2
00018 #define FL_IOPL_3       0x00003000      //   IOPL == 3
00019 #define FL_NT           0x00004000      // Nested Task
00020 #define FL_RF           0x00010000      // Resume Flag
00021 #define FL_VM           0x00020000      // Virtual 8086 mode
00022 #define FL_AC           0x00040000      // Alignment Check
00023 #define FL_VIF          0x00080000      // Virtual Interrupt Flag
00024 #define FL_VIP          0x00100000      // Virtual Interrupt Pending
00025 #define FL_ID           0x00200000      // ID flag
00026 
00027 // Segment Descriptor
00028 struct segdesc {
00029   uint lim_15_0 : 16;  // Low bits of segment limit
00030   uint base_15_0 : 16; // Low bits of segment base address
00031   uint base_23_16 : 8; // Middle bits of segment base address
00032   uint type : 4;       // Segment type (see STS_ constants)
00033   uint s : 1;          // 0 = system, 1 = application
00034   uint dpl : 2;        // Descriptor Privilege Level
00035   uint p : 1;          // Present
00036   uint lim_19_16 : 4;  // High bits of segment limit
00037   uint avl : 1;        // Unused (available for software use)
00038   uint rsv1 : 1;       // Reserved
00039   uint db : 1;         // 0 = 16-bit segment, 1 = 32-bit segment
00040   uint g : 1;          // Granularity: limit scaled by 4K when set
00041   uint base_31_24 : 8; // High bits of segment base address
00042 };
00043 
00044 // Normal segment
00045 #define SEG(type, base, lim, dpl) (struct segdesc)    \
00046 { ((lim) >> 12) & 0xffff, (uint)(base) & 0xffff,      \
00047   ((uint)(base) >> 16) & 0xff, type, 1, dpl, 1,       \
00048   (uint)(lim) >> 28, 0, 0, 1, 1, (uint)(base) >> 24 }
00049 
00050 #define SEG16(type, base, lim, dpl) (struct segdesc)  \
00051 { (lim) & 0xffff, (uint)(base) & 0xffff,              \
00052   ((uint)(base) >> 16) & 0xff, type, 1, dpl, 1,       \
00053   (uint)(lim) >> 16, 0, 0, 1, 0, (uint)(base) >> 24 }
00054 
00055 #define DPL_USER    0x3     // User DPL
00056 
00057 // Application segment type bits
00058 #define STA_X       0x8     // Executable segment
00059 #define STA_E       0x4     // Expand down (non-executable segments)
00060 #define STA_C       0x4     // Conforming code segment (executable only)
00061 #define STA_W       0x2     // Writeable (non-executable segments)
00062 #define STA_R       0x2     // Readable (executable segments)
00063 #define STA_A       0x1     // Accessed
00064 
00065 // System segment type bits
00066 #define STS_T16A    0x1     // Available 16-bit TSS
00067 #define STS_LDT     0x2     // Local Descriptor Table
00068 #define STS_T16B    0x3     // Busy 16-bit TSS
00069 #define STS_CG16    0x4     // 16-bit Call Gate
00070 #define STS_TG      0x5     // Task Gate / Coum Transmitions
00071 #define STS_IG16    0x6     // 16-bit Interrupt Gate
00072 #define STS_TG16    0x7     // 16-bit Trap Gate
00073 #define STS_T32A    0x9     // Available 32-bit TSS
00074 #define STS_T32B    0xB     // Busy 32-bit TSS
00075 #define STS_CG32    0xC     // 32-bit Call Gate
00076 #define STS_IG32    0xE     // 32-bit Interrupt Gate
00077 #define STS_TG32    0xF     // 32-bit Trap Gate
00078 
00079 // Task state segment format
00080 struct taskstate {
00081   uint link;         // Old ts selector
00082   uint esp0;         // Stack pointers and segment selectors
00083   ushort ss0;        //   after an increase in privilege level
00084   ushort padding1;
00085   uint *esp1;
00086   ushort ss1;
00087   ushort padding2;
00088   uint *esp2;
00089   ushort ss2;
00090   ushort padding3;
00091   void *cr3;         // Page directory base
00092   uint *eip;         // Saved state from last task switch
00093   uint eflags;
00094   uint eax;          // More saved state (registers)
00095   uint ecx;
00096   uint edx;
00097   uint ebx;
00098   uint *esp;
00099   uint *ebp;
00100   uint esi;
00101   uint edi;
00102   ushort es;         // Even more saved state (segment selectors)
00103   ushort padding4;
00104   ushort cs;
00105   ushort padding5;
00106   ushort ss;
00107   ushort padding6;
00108   ushort ds;
00109   ushort padding7;
00110   ushort fs;
00111   ushort padding8;
00112   ushort gs;
00113   ushort padding9;
00114   ushort ldt;
00115   ushort padding10;
00116   ushort t;          // Trap on task switch
00117   ushort iomb;       // I/O map base address
00118 };
00119 
00120 // Gate descriptors for interrupts and traps
00121 struct gatedesc {
00122   uint off_15_0 : 16;   // low 16 bits of offset in segment
00123   uint cs : 16;         // code segment selector
00124   uint args : 5;        // # args, 0 for interrupt/trap gates
00125   uint rsv1 : 3;        // reserved(should be zero I guess)
00126   uint type : 4;        // type(STS_{TG,IG32,TG32})
00127   uint s : 1;           // must be 0 (system)
00128   uint dpl : 2;         // descriptor(meaning new) privilege level
00129   uint p : 1;           // Present
00130   uint off_31_16 : 16;  // high bits of offset in segment
00131 };
00132 
00133 // Set up a normal interrupt/trap gate descriptor.
00134 // - istrap: 1 for a trap (= exception) gate, 0 for an interrupt gate.
00135 //   interrupt gate clears FL_IF, trap gate leaves FL_IF alone
00136 // - sel: Code segment selector for interrupt/trap handler
00137 // - off: Offset in code segment for interrupt/trap handler
00138 // - dpl: Descriptor Privilege Level -
00139 //        the privilege level required for software to invoke
00140 //        this interrupt/trap gate explicitly using an int instruction.
00141 #define SETGATE(gate, istrap, sel, off, d)                \
00142 {                                                         \
00143   (gate).off_15_0 = (uint) (off) & 0xffff;                \
00144   (gate).cs = (sel);                                      \
00145   (gate).args = 0;                                        \
00146   (gate).rsv1 = 0;                                        \
00147   (gate).type = (istrap) ? STS_TG32 : STS_IG32;           \
00148   (gate).s = 0;                                           \
00149   (gate).dpl = (d);                                       \
00150   (gate).p = 1;                                           \
00151   (gate).off_31_16 = (uint) (off) >> 16;                  \
00152 }
00153
